datafield.subfield: Title of second work from heading at opening on p.37 and in GAL:
Title from heading at opening of second work on p.37:
هذا هو الكتاب المستطاب المعروف بالمجلي الموسوم بمسلك الافهام والنور المنجي من الظلام
قانون الاشراقيين في بيان الشأن الآلهي
310 x 210 mm. bound to 320 x 220 mm.
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 932

Origin: As appears in colophon on p.36, transcription of opening selections completed 8 Jumada I 1359, corresponding to 14 June 1940 and 7 Baʼūnah 1656. Likely copied in Egypt and eventually bound for James Heyworth-Dunne (d.1974).
Former shelfmark: Mich. Isl. Ms. temp. no. 81

Binding: Boards covered in black textured cloth with black leather over spine (quarter binding) ; pastedowns and flyleaves in wove paper printed with a floral vegetal pattern in pale pink and green ; spine gold-stamped with title and decorative accents over raised bands "قانون الاشراقيين" ; overall in fairly good condition.

Script: Ruqʻah ; compact hand in a thin to medium line (line thickness changes) ; serifless and freely ligatured with slight effect of tilt to the right, mainly closed counters, pointing in strokes rather than distinct dots.
Layout: Written in 26-28 lines per page.
Collation: Two pages between sections of opening selections left blank (see pp.12-13) ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization.
Colophon: [Sharḥ Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam] "Scribal," reads "تم نسخه في الثامن من جمادى الاولى احد شهور سنة ١٣٥٩ الموافق للرابع عشر من يونيو ١٩٤٠ وللسابع من بؤنه ١٦٥٦"

Explicit: [Sharḥ Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam] "ثم قبلت بعد ذلك صور بعد صور فان لا يمكن لاحد ان يرى الهيولي لانها تدلست [؟] صور كثيرة فهي خفية تحتها لا ينالها شيء من ... البتة الى هنا وقف قلم الكتاب وكان خاتمة هذا الكتاب المستطاب والله اعلم بالصواب واليه المرجع والمآب" ; [Mujlī] "وانت اذا حققت ذلك عرفت ما فيه من ... الكثرة والغراء [؟] الصور"

Incipit: [Sharḥ Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam] "اعلم ان الشأن الآلهي والامر التدبيري دوري فان الحضرة الاحدية اذا اقتضت التعين الاول والعين الواحدة المسماة في لسان اهل الذوق بالبرزخ الجامع الجامع [كذا] بين احكام الوجوب والامكان المحيط بالطرفين ..." ; [Mujlī] "يا ذا المن الجسيم والطول العظيم والشأن القويم والامر الحكيم ..."
2. p.37-p.204 : Hādhā huwa al-Kitāb al-mustaṭāb al-maʻrūf bi-al-Mujallī al-mawsūm bi-Maslak al-afhām wa-al-Nūr al-munjī min al-ẓalām / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī Ibn Abī Jumhūr al-Aḥsāʼī.
1. p.1-p.36 : [selections from Sharḥ Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam opening with al-Qānūn al-thālith fī Bayān al-shaʼn al-ilāhī] / ʻAbd al-Razzāq al-Qāshānī.
Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Abī Jumhūr al-Aḥsāʼī. Mujlī mirʼāt al-munjī fī al-kalām wa-al-ḥikmatayn wa-al-taṣawwuf. Reprint of lithograph edition by Aḥmad al-Shīrāzī, ed. Sabine Schmidtke. Tihrān, 2008.
Madelung, W. "Ibn ABĪ ḎJ̲UMHŪR al-AḤSĀʾĪ, Muḥammad b. ʿAlī b. Ibrāhīm b. Ḥasan b. Ibrāhīm b. Ḥasan al-Had̲j̲arī." in EI2,
Āghā Buzurg al-Ṭihrānī. al-Dharīʻah ilá taṣānīf al-Shīʻah,

Careful copy of selections from the commentary by ʻAbd al-Razzāq al-Qāshānī (d.1330?) on Ibn ʻArabī's Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam followed by Ibn Abī Jumhūr's (d. after 1499) Kitāb al-Mujlī or Mujlī mirʼāt al-Nūr al-munjī, a supercommentary upon his own kalām work, Maslak al-afhām fī ʻilm al-kalām and its commentary, al-Nūr al-munjī min al-ẓalām (seemingly incomplete transcript with commentary, likely that of the copyist).

On upper pastedown, label with ex libris of James Heyworth-Dunne (d.1974), stamped with inventory number, "Ex Libris | J. Heyworth-Dunne | D. Lit. (London) | No 7973" ; UM Library inscription on 'title page' (p.1) "Dunning | Heyworth-Dunne | 6-11-51 | 71955" ; marginal glosses.
Ibn Abī Jumhūr al-Aḥsāʼī, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī,
Ibn Abī Jumhūr al-Aḥsāʼī, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī,
ابن ابي جمهور الاحسائي, محمد بن علي.
